project.title: Robust Control of Shape Memory Alloys for Assistive Robotics
project.role: PhD Research – SMMS Lab, University of Iowa
project.summary: Development of physics-based models and adaptive controllers for SMA actuators for application in wearable and assistive robotic devices.
project.highlight: Designed robust and adaptive controllers with real experiments.
Published in Shape Memory and Superelasticity (Accepted).

project.title: TCAM-Powered Soft Robotic Systems
project.role: PhD Research – SMMS Lab, University of Iowa
project.summary: Designed and validated TCAM-powered continuum robots for underwater robotics and rehabilitation systems.
project.highlight: Low-cost continuum soft robotic arm (TCAM actuator).
Octopus-inspired muscular hydrostats for underwater flow control.

project.title: Wrist Rehabilitation Exoskeleton
project.summary: A lightweight wearable exoskeleton powered by TCAM actuators for wrist rehabilitation.
project.highlight: Part of Editor’s Choice publication in Robotics.

project.title: Adaptive Lower-Limb Prosthetics & Foot Mechanisms
project.role: Research Assistant – Bionics Lab, University of Moratuwa
project.summary: Designed adaptive foot mechanisms and prosthetic components for gait biomechanics applications.
project.highlight: Developed articulated foot prototypes with 3D printing.

project.title: Modular Artificial Shoulder Prosthesis
project.summary: Developed a modular artificial shoulder joint with multi-DOF actuation and low-level control validation.
project.highlight: Achieved working prototype with active joint control.
